intro: Cyathostemma viridiflorum var. scortechinii, commonly known as the greenflower cyathostemma, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, elongated, spiky inflorescences that resemble a crown of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, woody stems and broad, palmate leaves. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for its unique floral display.
